info.title: The Getty MART System Endpoints
info.description: This OpenAPI document describes the endpoints available from the Getty MART Linked Data system. The current endpoints, which are all read-only, comprise of an Activity Streams endpoint that can be polled to discover changes in the data stored by MART, and a record endpoint that provides access to any of the available records contained within the system.

get.description: The Activity Stream endpoint for MART. This endpoint exposes an Activity Stream version 2.0 compliant feed that can be polled to discover changes to data stored within MART. This base Activity Stream endpoint enables systems to discover how many items are currently available from the stream, and to obtain the current URLs for the first and last pages of the stream.

200.description: A response including the type of the stream, an OrderedCollection, in MART's case, the current total count of items in the stream, the page start index, and URLs referencing the first and last pages of the Activity Stream.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Activity Stream response.

get.description: A response regarding the desired page from the Activity Stream.

parameters.name: pageID
parameters.description: Numeric index of the desired page.

200.description: A successful response containing the desired page from the Activity Stream.

404.description: A response noting that the desired page does not exist. The page offset should be checked to ensure that it is valid, and that the request URL has been specified correctly.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Activity Stream response.

get.description: The record endpoint. The URLs for each record are provided via the Activity Stream feed.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace for the desired record as provided as part of the record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The entity name for the desired record as provided as part of the record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description: The entity record UUID for the desired record as provided as part of the record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

200.description: A response containg the desired Museum Collection Object record.

404.description: A response noting that the desired record does not exist. The record URL should be checked to ensure that it is valid.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Activity Stream response.

get.description: The Museum Object record endpoint. The URLs for each Object record are provided via the Activity Stream feed.

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description: The entity record UUID for the desired record as provided as part of the record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

200.description: A response containg the desired Museum Collection Object record.

404.description: A response noting that the desired record does not exist. The Object record URL should be checked to ensure that it is valid.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Object record response.

get.description: The Museum Group record endpoint. The URLs for each Group record are provided via the Activity Stream feed.

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description: The entity record UUID for the desired record as provided as part of the Group record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

200.description: A response containg the desired Museum Collection Group record.

404.description: A response noting that the desired record does not exist. The Group record URL should be checked to ensure that it is valid.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Group record response.

get.description: The Museum Person record endpoint. The URLs for each Person record are provided via the Activity Stream feed.

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description: The entity record UUID for the desired record as provided as part of the Person record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

200.description: A response containg the desired Museum Collection Person record.

404.description: A response noting that the desired record does not exist. The Person record URL should be checked to ensure that it is valid.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Person record response.

get.description: The Museum Place record endpoint. The URLs for each Place record are provided via the Activity Stream feed.

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description: The entity record UUID for the desired record as provided as part of the Place record URL via the Activity Stream endpoint.

200.description: A response containg the desired Museum Collection Place record.

404.description: A response noting that the desired record does not exist. The Place record URL should be checked to ensure that it is valid.

500.description: A error occurred at the server when trying to generate the Place record response.

activity-stream.description: JSON serialized representation of the Activity Stream.

@context.description: The context schema for the Activity Stream.

id.description: The ID of the Activity Stream expressed as an absolute URL.

summary.description: The summary description of the Activity Stream.

type.description: The Activity Stream response type. Will always be 'OrderedCollection'.

startIndex.description: The start index of the Activity Stream pages, either 0 or 1.

totalItems.description: A count of the total number of items currently available from the Activity Stream.

id.description: The ID of the first page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'

id.description: The ID of the last page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'

activity-stream-page.description: JSON serialized representation of the Activity Stream.

@context.description: The context schema for the Activity Stream.

id.description: The ID of the Activity Stream expressed as an absolute URL.

summary.description: The summary description of the Activity Stream.

type.description: The Activity Stream response type. Will always be 'OrderedCollection'.

startIndex.description: The start index of the Activity Stream pages, either 0 or 1.

totalItems.description: A count of the total number of items currently available from the Activity Stream.

id.description: The ID of the first page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream. Will always be 'OrderedCollection'.

id.description: The ID of the first page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'.

id.description: The ID of the last page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'.

id.description: The ID of the previous page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'.

id.description: The ID of the next page of the Activity Stream, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.description: The format for the content contained within the Activity Stream page. Will always be 'OrderedCollectionPage'.

museum-collection-object.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Human Made Objects (Artifacts) Entity Documents
museum-collection-object.description: This document describes the structure and content of Object entity documents stored within the Getty MART Linked Data system. The Place entity documents follow the Person entity schema defined at https://linked.art/model/object/

citation.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Human Made Objects (Artifacts)

resourceInfo.abstract: The J. Paul Getty Trust is sharing Linked Data representations of its Collections data.

id.title: The Object Document's ID
id.description: This field contains the Object's ID, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.title: The Object Document's Type
type.description: This field contains the Object document's type, expressed as a string. It will always be 'Object' for Object entity documents.

_label.title: The Object Document's Developer-Friendly Label
_label.description: This field contains the document's developer-friendly label. This label is intended for reference purposes only as a development aid to provide a short human-readable summary of the contents of the current document or document fragment, and is not intended to be acted upon or displayed in any downstream system.
examples: A Wooded Landscape with Travelers on a Path through a Hamlet

identified_by.title: The Object's Identifiers
identified_by.description: This field contains an array of identifiers related to the object.

produced_by.title: The Object's produced_by Property
produced_by.description: This field contains information about the production of the object, including whom the object was produced by and when it was produced, if known.

classified_as.title: The Object's classified_as Property
classified_as.description: This field contains classifications associated with the Object. These may include classifications related to the Object's type, its culture, and style.

referred_to_by.title: The Object's referred_to_by Property
referred_to_by.description: This field contains related information about the Object. This may include one or descriptions of the Object, the Object's culture, its dimensions, etc.

examples.content:
In May 1889, after episodes of self-mutilation and hospitalization, Vincent van Gogh chose to enter an asylum in Saint-Rémy, France. There, in the last year before his death, he created almost 130 paintings. Within the first week, he began Irises, working from nature in the asylum's garden. The cropped composition, divided into broad areas of vivid color with monumental irises overflowing its borders, was probably influenced by the decorative patterning of Japanese woodblock prints.

There are no known drawings for this painting; Van Gogh himself considered it a study. His brother Theo quickly recognized its quality and submitted it to the Salon des Indépendants in September 1889, writing Vincent of the exhibition: "[It] strikes the eye from afar. It is a beautiful study full of air and life."

Each one of Van Gogh's irises is unique. He carefully studied their movements and shapes to create a variety of curved silhouettes bounded by wavy, twisting, and curling lines. The painting's first owner, French art critic Octave Mirbeau, one of Van Gogh's earliest supporters, wrote: "How well he has understood the exquisite nature of flowers!"

current_keeper.title: The Object's current_keeper Property
current_keeper.description: This field contains information about the object's current keeper.

member_of._label: J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
The J. Paul Getty Trust, Los Angeles, California

current_location.title: The Object's current_location Property
current_location.description: This field contains information about the object's current location, referenced as a Place entity.

examples: Getty Center, Museum West Pavilion, Gallery W204

classified_as.description: For Objects that are on display, the 'classified_as' property will always include the 'Galleries (Display Spaces)' classification as per the first of the example values below; for Objects that are off display, the classification will always include the 'Storage Spaces' classification as per the second of the example values below.

examples._label: Getty Center, Museum West Pavilion, Gallery W204

identified_by.content: Getty Center, Museum West Pavilion, Gallery W204

current_owner.title: The Object's current_owner Property
current_owner.description: This field contains information about the object's current owner.

examples._label: J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California

member_of._label: The J. Paul Getty Trust, Los Angeles, California

subject_of.title: The Object's subject_of Property
subject_of.description: This field contains information about resources that the object is a subject of.

representation.title: The Object's representation Property
representation.description: This field contains information about other digital representations of the object, such as digital images depicting the object.

made_of.title: The Object's made_of Property
made_of.description: This field contains information about what the object is made of.

carries.title: The Object's carries Property
carries.description: This field contains information about things carried by the object, such as inscriptions, markings, signatures and watermarks.

museum-collection-group.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Person Entity Documents
museum-collection-group.description: This document describes the structure and content of Person entity documents stored within the Getty MART Linked Data system. The Place entity documents follow the Person entity schema defined at https://linked.art/model/actor/

citation.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Person Entity Documents

resourceInfo.abstract: The J. Paul Getty Trust is sharing Linked Data representations of its Collections data.

id.title: The Person Document's ID
id.description: This field contains the Person's ID, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.title: The Person Document's Type
type.description: This field contains the Person document's type, expressed as a string. It will always be 'Person' for Person entity documents.

_label.title: The Person Document's Developer-Friendly Label
_label.description: This field contains the document's developer-friendly label. This label is intended for reference purposes only as a development aid to provide a short human-readable summary of the contents of the current document or document fragment, and is not intended to be acted upon or displayed in any downstream system.

examples.content: Art was Van Gogh's means of personal, spiritual redemption, and his voluminous letters to his devoted brother Theo, one of which is quoted here, offer profound insight into the artistic struggle. Van Gogh became an artist in 1881. Although he studied briefly in Antwerp and Paris, he was largely self-taught. He ultimately chose to live in the country, and most of his paintings capture his deep affinity for nature. Theo, an art dealer, introduced Vincent to Paris's most advanced painters, and his work changed under the influences of Edgar Degas, Paul Gauguin, Georges Seurat, and Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec. The flatness of color and shape in Japanese woodcuts also inspired him. Van Gogh's color expressed his emotions as he responded to the world. His insistence on color's expressive possibilities led him to develop a corresponding expressiveness in applying pigment. His brushstrokes of thick, opaque paint almost seem drawn. His often violently interacting colors and forms and strong expressive line influenced nearly every artistic movement that came after him: Symbolism, Fauvism, Expressionism, and beyond.

born.title: The Person Birth
born.description: This field contains information about the referenced person's birth, including when and where it took place, depending on what is currently known.

died.title: The Person Death
died.description: This field contains information about the referenced person's death, if this has occurred, including when and where it took place, depending on what is currently known.

identified_by.title: The Person's identified_by Property
identified_by.description: This field contains identifiers associated with the Person. These may include names used to refer to the Person, alternative document IDs, alternative names, etc.

examples._label: Gallery Systems' The Museum System (TMS) ID

classified_as._label: Gallery Systems' The Museum System (TMS) ID

exact_match.title: The Person exact_match Property
exact_match.description: This field contains any exact matches for records contained in other system's which are also digital representations of the same Person. This may include references to entries in The Getty's Union List of Artist Names (ULAN) controlled vocabulary system (http://vocab.getty.edu) for instance.

classified_as.title: The Person's classified_as Property
classified_as.description: This field contains classifications associated with the Person. These may include classifications related to the Person's type, their culture, nationality, and other classifiable attributes, etc.

Van Gogh became an artist in 1881. Although he studied briefly in Antwerp and Paris, he was largely self-taught. museum-collection-place.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Place Entity Documents
museum-collection-place.description: This document describes the structure and content of Place entity documents stored within the Getty MART Linked Data system. The Place entity documents follow the Place entity schema defined at https://linked.art/model/place/

citation.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Place Entity Documents

resourceInfo.abstract: The J. Paul Getty Trust is sharing Linked Data representations of its Collections data.

id.title: The Place Document's ID
id.description: This field contains the Place's ID, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.title: The Place Document's Type
type.description: This field contains the Place document's type, expressed as a string. It will always be 'Place' for Place entity documents.

_label.title: The Place Document's Developer-Friendly Label
_label.description: This field contains the document's developer-friendly label. This label is intended for reference purposes only as a development aid to provide a short human-readable summary of the contents of the current document or document fragment, and is not intended to be acted upon or displayed in any downstream system.
examples: Getty Center, Museum West Pavilion, Gallery W203

classified_as.title: The Place's classified_as Property
classified_as.description: This field contains classifications associated with the Place. These may include classifications related to the Place's type, and other classifiable attributes, etc.

identified_by.title: The Place's identified_by Property
identified_by.description: This field contains identifiers associated with the Place. These may include names used to refer to the Place, alternative document IDs, alternative names, etc.

part_of.title: The Place's part_of Property
part_of.description: This field contains information about the Place's hierarchy, whereby the system may provide additional partitioning information about the Place. This may include information about the Place's parent place, such as a city's parent region, a region's parent country, etc.

current_location.title: The Place's current_location Property
current_location.description: This field contains information about the Place's current location. For instance, if the Place describes a building, its current_location property can be used to describe the building's location.
